sect1.title: Session Co-Ordinator
sect1.para: Being a Session Co-Ordinator you are responsible for scheduling contributions and breaks within your session. These contributions need to be imported by the session manager or conference manager before you can add them to your session.

You are given this co-ordinator access by either the Session Manager or the Conference Manager. The Conference Manager sets the level of modification rights for all of the session co-ordinators. You can access your session by selecting 'my session' from the left hand menu.

sect1.title: Session Co-ordination
sect1.para: There are three levels of co-ordination modification that the Conference Manager can give to session co-ordinators.
If you do not have access or the rights to any part within your session you will be presented with this page:

sect2.title: Basic Rights

listitem.para: Manage the timetable with restrictions - adding contributions, creating breaks, reschedule contributions and breaks.
View the sessions' main information (cannot modify)
View comments from the conference manager (cannot modify)

sect2.para: Your co-ordination will mainly take place within the Timetable tab of your session:

sect2.title: Contribution Modification Rights
sect2.para: If the conference manager has allowed contribution modification rights you can:

listitem.para: Modify the main data of the contribution.
Set the access controls for the contribution - i.e. give submission rights to presenters or allow others to manage the contribution.

sect2.para: To modify the contribution click on it's name from either the timetable or the contribution list.
The contribution management area (For a more detailed explanation please see "Contribution" in the Indico User Guide 2.4.3.1):

sect2.title: Unrestricted Timetable Management
sect2.para: If the conference manager has allowed unrestricted timetable management rights you can:

listitem.para: Add contributions and breaks, reschedule contributions and breaks as before
